data: Indicated in symptomatic atrial fibrillation in the absence of ischemic / structural heart disease or decompensated heart failure

Absolute Contraindications:
- Pre-existing advanced atrioventricular block (second or third degree atrioventricular block) or conduction system disorders (left bundle branch block, or right bundle branch block when associated with left hemiblock) unless a functioning pacemaker is present
- Ischemic heart disease (active ischemia or history of myocardial infarction)
- Clinical heart failure or left ventricular ejection fraction less than 40%
- Brugada Syndrome

Relative Contraindications:
- Sinus bradycardia (less then 50 beats per minute) or sinus node dysfunction (e.g. sick sinus syndrome)
- Significant left ventricular hypertrophy 
           -  left ventricular hypertrophy with repolarization abnormalities (ST and T wave changes on ECG) 
           -  left ventricular hypertrophy greater than 1.4 cm on echocardiogram
- Hypokalemia or hypomagnesemia (correct imbalances prior to use and throughout therapy)
- Severe hepatic or severe renal impairment (CrCl less than 35 mL/min)
If creatinine clearance less than 35 mL/min, consider alternate antiarrhythmic drug unless flecainide trough monitoring is available
